de.lambeck.pned.models.gui

Interface IGuiModelController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IInfo_DrawingAreaSize, IInfo_MousePos, IInfo_SelectionRangeSize, IInfo_Status
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GuiModelController

    public interface IGuiModelController
extends IInfo_MousePos, IInfo_SelectionRangeSize, IInfo_DrawingAreaSize, IInfo_Status
    Interface for controllers for GUI models representing a Petri net. This means models with all the graphical information (from a data model or drawn by the user).
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320

    • Method Detail

      • addGuiModel

        void addGuiModel(java.lang.String modelName,
                 java.lang.String displayName)
        Adds a GUI model for a non-existing file.

        Note: This is intended to be used to add new models which are not coming from a PNML file (e.g. "Untitled1", "Untitled2"... or "New1", "New2"...)
        Parameters:
        modelName - The full path name of the PNML file
        displayName - The title of the tab (= the file name)

      • isModifiedGuiModel

        boolean isModifiedGuiModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Checks if the specified GUI model has been modified.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        Returns:
        True if the model has been modified; otherwise false

      • resetModifiedGuiModel

        void resetModifiedGuiModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Resets the "modified" state of the specified model.

        Note: Use this method after loading a PNML file because the model has not been changed by the user after adding elements from the PNML file only.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • removeGuiModel

        void removeGuiModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Removes the specified GUI model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • renameGuiModel

        void renameGuiModel(IGuiModel model,
                    java.lang.String newModelName,
                    java.lang.String newDisplayName)
        Renames the specified IGuiModel. (Use this in case the user has saved the file under a new file name.)
        Parameters:
        model - The IGuiModel
        newModelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        newDisplayName - The title of the tab (= the file name)

      • getGuiModel

        IGuiModel getGuiModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Returns the specified IGuiModel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        Returns:
        The specified GUI model

        Parameters:
        drawPanel - The specified IDrawPanel

      • getModifiedGuiModels

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getModifiedGuiModels()
        Returns a list of GUI models which have been modified and need to be saved.
        Returns:
        List of modified GUI models

      • addPlaceToCurrentGuiModel

        void addPlaceToCurrentGuiModel(java.lang.String id,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               EPlaceToken initialTokens,
                               java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a place to the current GUI model.

        Intended use: adding a place after reading from a PNML file because these places may have a name.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the place
        name - The name of the place
        initialTokens - The initial tokens count of the place
        position - The position (center) of the place

      • addTransitionToCurrentGuiModel

        void addTransitionToCurrentGuiModel(java.lang.String id,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    java.awt.Point position)
        Adds a transition to the current GUI model.

        Intended use: adding a transition after reading from a PNML file because these transitions may have a name.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the transition
        name - The name of the transition
        position - The position (center) of the transition

      • addArcToCurrentGuiModel

        void addArcToCurrentGuiModel(java.lang.String id,
                             java.lang.String sourceId,
                             java.lang.String targetId)
        Adds an arc to the current GUI model.

        Note: This method should be the same for GUI events and reading from a PNML file because arcs will have all 3 attributes in either cases.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the arc
        sourceId - The id of the source (Place or Transition)
        targetId - The id of the target (Place or Transition)

      • createNewPlaceInCurrentGuiModel

        void createNewPlaceInCurrentGuiModel()
        Callback for NewPlaceAction, creates a new IGuiPlace in the current IGuiModel.

      • createNewTransitionInCurrentGuiModel

        void createNewTransitionInCurrentGuiModel()
        Callback for NewPlaceAction, creates a new GuiTransition in the current IGuiModel.

      • setSourceNodeForNewArc

        void setSourceNodeForNewArc()
        Sets the IGuiNode at the popup menu location as source for the new IGuiArc in the current IGuiModel.

      • getStateAddingNewArc

        boolean getStateAddingNewArc()
        Checks if this IGuiModelController is currently in the state to add a new IGuiArc.
        Returns:
        True if this GUI model controller is waiting for the second IGuiNode to finish the Arc; otherwise false.

      • getSourceForNewArcType

        ENodeType getSourceForNewArcType()
        Returns the type of node currently set as source for the new IGuiArc to be added by this IGuiModelController.
        Returns:
        The ENodeType of the node

      • setTargetNodeForNewArc

        void setTargetNodeForNewArc()
        Sets the IGuiNode at the popup menu location as target for the new IGuiArc in the current IGuiModel.

      • resetStateAddingNewArc

        void resetStateAddingNewArc()
        Resets the state of the IGuiModelController to add a new IGuiArc.

      • getSelectableElementAtLocation

        IGuiElement getSelectableElementAtLocation(java.awt.Point p)
        Returns the selectable element at the specified Point. Returns the one with the highest z-value if there is more than 1 at this location.

        Note: This means any element, not only nodes!

        Note: Not private to grant access to class PopupMenuManager
        Parameters:
        p - The specified Point
        Returns:
        A GUI element

      • isSelectableElement

        boolean isSelectableElement(IGuiElement element)
        Checks if an element can be selected. (squares, circles and arrows)
        Parameters:
        element - The element to check
        Returns:
        True if the element can be selected; otherwise false

      • renameSelectedGuiElement

        void renameSelectedGuiElement()
        Callback for the EditRenameAction in the ApplicationController. Renames the selected element in the current GUI model.

      • updateDrawing

        void updateDrawing(java.awt.Rectangle area)
        Tells the GUI model controller that an area has changed and needs repainting.
        Parameters:
        area - The area to update; set to null for complete repaint

      • removeSelectedGuiElements

        void removeSelectedGuiElements()
        Callback for the EditDeleteAction in the ApplicationController. Removes all selected elements from the current GUI model.

      • removeGuiArc

        void removeGuiArc(java.lang.String arcId)
        Handles the application controllers info to remove an arc from the GUI model.
        Parameters:
        arcId - The id of the arc

      • clearCurrentGuiModel

        void clearCurrentGuiModel()
        Removes all elements from the current GUI model.

      • mouseClick_Occurred

        void mouseClick_Occurred(java.awt.Point mousePressedLocation,
                         java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Callback for the DrawPanel.

        Note: Rejects a mouseClicked event (as unintended) if mousePressed was on a different element than mouseReleased.
        Parameters:
        mousePressedLocation - The location of the mousePressed event
        e - The current location (mouseReleased)

      • mouseClick_WithCtrl_Occurred

        void mouseClick_WithCtrl_Occurred(java.awt.Point mousePressedLocation,
                                  java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Callback for the DrawPanel.

        Note: Rejects a mouseClicked event (as unintended) if mousePressed was on a different element than mouseReleased.
        Parameters:
        mousePressedLocation - The location of the mousePressed event
        e - The current location (mouseReleased)

      • mouseDragged

        void mouseDragged(int distance_x,
                  int distance_y)
        Callback for the DrawPanel.
        Parameters:
        distance_x - The distance in x direction
        distance_y - The distance in y direction

      • updateDataNodePositions

        void updateDataNodePositions()
        Handles the MyMouseAdapter request to update the positions of the nodes in the data model after mouse dragging.

      • keyEvent_Escape_Occurred

        void keyEvent_Escape_Occurred()
        Callback for the DrawPanel.

      • keyEvent_Delete_Occurred

        void keyEvent_Delete_Occurred()
        Callback for the KeyBinding event in the DrawPanel.

        Note: Invokes removeSelectedGuiElements()

      • keyEvent_F2_Occurred

        void keyEvent_F2_Occurred()
        Callback for EditRenameAction and the KeyBindings in DrawPanel.

        Note: Invokes renameSelectedGuiElements()

      • selectElementAtPopupMenu

        void selectElementAtPopupMenu()
        Callback for the popup menus of the IDrawPanel. Selects the element that contained the popup trigger.

      • moveElementToForeground

        void moveElementToForeground()
        Callback for MenuBar and popup menus of the IDrawPanel. Assigns the specified element to the foreground. (1 level higher in z direction than the current top element)

      • moveElementToBackground

        void moveElementToBackground()
        Callback for MenuBar and popup menus of the IDrawPanel. Assigns the specified element to the background. (1 level higher in z direction than the current top element)

      • moveElementOneLayerUp

        void moveElementOneLayerUp()
        Callback for MenuBar and popup menus of the IDrawPanel. Swaps the layer of this element with the next higher element.

      • moveElementOneLayerDown

        void moveElementOneLayerDown()
        Callback for MenuBar and popup menus of the IDrawPanel. Swaps the layer of this element with the next lower element.

      • changeShapeSize

        void changeShapeSize(int size)
        Callback for the SizeSlider to change the size of the elements on the draw panels.
        Parameters:
        size - The new size

      • resetAllGuiStartPlaces

        void resetAllGuiStartPlaces(java.lang.String modelName)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to reset all start places on the draw panel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • resetAllGuiEndPlaces

        void resetAllGuiEndPlaces(java.lang.String modelName)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to reset all end places on the draw panel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • setGuiStartPlace

        void setGuiStartPlace(java.lang.String modelName,
                      java.lang.String placeId,
                      boolean b)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to update the start place on the draw panel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placeId - The id of the IGuiPlace
        b - True to set as start place; otherwise false

      • setGuiStartPlaceCandidate

        void setGuiStartPlaceCandidate(java.lang.String modelName,
                               java.lang.String placeId,
                               boolean b)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to update the start place candidate on the draw panel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placeId - The id of the IGuiPlace
        b - True to set as start place candidate; otherwise false

      • setGuiEndPlace

        void setGuiEndPlace(java.lang.String modelName,
                    java.lang.String placeId,
                    boolean b)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to update the end place on the draw panel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placeId - The id of the IGuiPlace
        b - True to set as end place; otherwise false

      • setGuiEndPlaceCandidate

        void setGuiEndPlaceCandidate(java.lang.String modelName,
                             java.lang.String placeId,
                             boolean b)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to update the end place candidate on the draw panel.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placeId - The id of the IGuiPlace
        b - True to set as end place candidate; otherwise false

      • highlightUnreachableGuiNode

        void highlightUnreachableGuiNode(java.lang.String modelName,
                                 java.lang.String nodeId,
                                 boolean b)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to update the status of the specified GUI node.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        nodeId - The id of the IGuiNode
        b - True = unreachable; False = can be reached from the start place and can reach the end place

      • removeAllGuiTokens

        void removeAllGuiTokens(java.lang.String modelName)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to remove the token from all GUI places in the specified model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • removeGuiToken

        void removeGuiToken(java.lang.String modelName,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> placesWithToken)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to remove the token from all specified GUI places in the specified GUI model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placesWithToken - A List of type String with the IDs of the specified places

      • addGuiToken

        void addGuiToken(java.lang.String modelName,
                 java.util.List<java.lang.String> placesWithToken)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to add a token to all specified GUI places in the specified GUI model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        placesWithToken - A List of type String with the IDs of the specified places

      • resetAllGuiTransitionsEnabledState

        void resetAllGuiTransitionsEnabledState(java.lang.String modelName)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to reset the "enabled" state on all transitions in the specified GUI model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • resetAllGuiTransitionsSafeState

        void resetAllGuiTransitionsSafeState(java.lang.String modelName)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to reset the "safe" state on all transitions in the specified GUI model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)

      • setGuiTransitionUnsafe

        void setGuiTransitionUnsafe(java.lang.String modelName,
                            java.lang.String transitionId)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to set the "safe" state on the specified transition in the specified GUI model to false.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        transitionId - The id of the IGuiTransition

      • setGuiTransitionEnabled

        void setGuiTransitionEnabled(java.lang.String modelName,
                             java.lang.String transitionId)
        Handles the ApplicationController request to set the "enabled" state on the specified transition in the specified GUI model.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model (This is intended to be the full path name of the PNML file represented by this model.)
        transitionId - The id of the IGuiTransition

      • fireGuiTransition

        void fireGuiTransition()
        Callback to fire the transition at the popup menu location.

        Note: The purpose of this method in IGuiModelController is mainly to provide the id of the desired IDataTransition to the IDataModelController because the popup menu location is known only to the GUI controller.

      • getCurrentMinZValue

        int getCurrentMinZValue()
        Returns:
        the minimum z value from the current IGuiModel

      • getCurrentMaxZValue

        int getCurrentMaxZValue()
        Returns:
        the maximum z value from the current IGuiModel
